    • Method Detail

      • getValueType

        public Class<?> getValueType()
        Description copied from interface: Element

        Returns the type of the values of this element, to be used when converting values in the form (for example in getFormDataConvertedToElementValueTypes method). Most element will return String.class Some elements will offer a setValueType method to change the value returned by this.

        If the returned type is null, the element will never by populated by a form, and its values will never be included in extracted form data with methods such as getFormData.

        Specified by:
        getValueType in interface Element
        Overrides:
        getValueType in class AbstractElement
        Returns:
        Value type class or null

      • setValueType

        public void setValueType(Class<?> valueType)
        Description copied from interface: Element

        Changes the value type returned by Element.getValueType() method.

        This type is used in a form to do automatic value conversion in methods such as getFormDataConvertedToElementValueTypes.

        By default, all elements have String value type.

        This type should only be set to a type which any value set to the element (after validation and filtering) can be converted to.

        Conversion of simple types such as numbers is supported by a form. For any other complex type such as Date, the element can implement the ElementWithValueConversion interface to completely override the conversion of values.

        Not every element supports change of this type. For example, a Checkbox is always Boolean and DatePicker is always Date

        Specified by:
        setValueType in interface Element
        Overrides:
        setValueType in class AbstractElement
        Parameters:
        valueType - New class for values of the element.

      • populate

        public Element populate(List<String> value)
        Description copied from interface: Element

        Sets the list of values to be hold by the element. This should only be used by a form during data population.

        This methods exists in order to make elements aware that the the data is being set by the form population (user input values), and be able to ignore the value if the element has the disabled property, or just ignore any value in special elements like Hidden, where the user should not be able to change the value of the element.

        A single-value element will ignore all values but the first.

        Specified by:
        populate in interface Element
        Overrides:
        populate in class AbstractElement
        Parameters:
        value - List of values or null
        Returns:
        This element

      • setValue

        public Element setValue(String value)
        Description copied from interface: Element
        Sets a single value to be hold by the element. It's converted to a list of one value by the element. This will never be called by a form on its own during data population, Element.populate(java.util.List) method will be called instead
        Specified by:
        setValue in interface Element
        Overrides:
        setValue in class AbstractElement
        Parameters:
        value - Single value or null
        Returns:
        This element

      • reset

        public Element reset()
        Description copied from interface: Element
        Resets the values and validation state of the element. The value of a disabled element won't be reset.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface Element
        Overrides:

      • setEscape

        public final void setEscape(boolean escape)
        Sets the escape HTML for this button's inner text (label).
        Parameters:
        escape - True for enabling escaping of HTML, false for disabling it

      • isEscape

        public final boolean isEscape()
        Returns the escape HTML flag for this button's inner text.
        Returns:
        True if escape is enabled, false otherwise
